page.title: 02ANNUAL GAMES INNERLEITHEN
page.content: In 1827 James Hogg the Ettrick Shepherd, Sir Walter Scott, Professor Wilson and Sherriff Glassford Bell organised an athletics meeting as well as their usual archery contest at the Batty (Bow Butts) and so began the{St. {Ronan's Annual Games}They included hop step and leap, putting the stone, high leap and wrestling. The Curly race {(Caerlee Steeplechase)}still takes place. The Games moved to the Green to Pirn Haugh and now in July spectators gather at the{Victoria Park,}for a professional running meeting sponsored by local businesses on Saturday of the Games Week. In the opening race,round the town,entrants must be local.Events range from the 90m handicap to the 1600m. The main race is the 110m Open Handicap with many top class runners. Among many trophies are the American Cup and the New Zealand Cup.
